series_description: This series documents DOC's compliance with requirements maintain its accreditation through a corrections-industry accrediting body. This series may include but is not limited to reports and checklists that have been made defunct and superseded by this series (water quality and quantity, VDOT work crews, generator inspections, and institutional records transfers), as well as other forms, spreadsheets, logs, and receipts.
retention_statement: 4 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the application of chemicals to agricultural products, dates of application, size of the area, was applied, how much was applied, registration and number, and how long before the product area can be and/or harvested. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports, forms, and logs
retention_statement: 2 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the types, quantities, and values of products produced by DOC's Agribusiness ventures. This may include, but is not limited to: inventories and
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents an inmate's authorization/consent to be contacted and/or interviewed by the media (includes the media's request), for the institution to release information the inmate that would otherwise be exempt from records requests, and for transfers of money to/from the inmate's account. This series may include, but is not limited to: forms correspondence.

This series documents a bereaved inmate's request to attend funeral or visit a dying relative, information about the pending event, any objections to or recommendations concerning the event, approval or rejection of the request, notification to local authorities, and documentation of the transpired event. This series may include, but is not limited to correspondence, and logs.

This series documents an inmate's request to join; accomplishments, work performed, assignments, and portfolios in; and completion of DOC's Career and Education programs, as well as an inmate's removal from a program. This series may include, but is not limited to: correspondence, forms, worksheets, drawings, and
This series documents an inmate's career readiness via a Career Readiness Certificate (CRC) and the level achieved. This series may include, but is not limited to: certificates.
This series documents all functions of the commissary, inventory, orders, and inmate purchases. This series may include, but is not limited to: forms, bubble sheets, and
retention_statement: 4 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the counts conducted by corrections officers, which return the number, physical location, and work station of inmates in each institution. This series includes, but not limited to reports.
retention_statement: 4 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the physical count by corrections of each inmate inside and outside of the institution (but not the result of the count), as well as the provision of a signature confirming that the count was performed. This series may include, but is not limited to: forms.
retention_statement: 1 Year after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents food service operations, which include, but are not limited to requisitions, USDA donations, utensil/lethal item controls, census/modified diets, inventory, production, and management controls. This series may but is not limited to: worksheets, logs, reports, and
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of calendar year

series_title: Grievances: Inmate Medical, Mental Health, and Protected Classes
series_description: This series documents inmate grievances pertaining to history, mental health, and/or discrimination of protected (age, color, disability, familial status, gender identity, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and veteran), including any actions taken. This series may include, but is not limited to: forms, correspondence, and reports.

This series documents all other inmate grievances not pertaining to medical history, mental health, or discrimination protected classes, including any actions taken. This series include, but is not limited to: forms, correspondence, and reports.

This series documents incidents at any institution involving inmates, visitors, and/or institution personnel, including information about the incident, those involved, and the results the investigation. This series may include, but is not limited to: correspondence, forms, and reports.

series_title: Inmate Adjustment/Disciplinary Hearings: Informal Resolution, Dismissal, or Not Guilty
series_description: This series documents inmate adjustment and/or disciplinary actions that resulted in an informal resolution, a dismissal, or a finding of not guilty. This series may include, but is not limited forms and correspondence.

This series documents all inmate movement inside and the institution, including Masterpass, trip passes, chain of custody, and out to court. This series may include, but is not limited to: logs, forms, receipts, and reports.
retention_statement: 4 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the assessment of and any into violations or suspected violations by inmates of a law, regulation, rule, or policy; the protection of evidence; and the findings for institutional or work crew investigations, but does not include investigations covered by a General Schedule Investigative Case File or a Prison Rape Elimination Act series. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports, forms, correspondence, video recordings, and lists.
This series documents the audits required by the Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA). This series may include, but is not limited to: reports, logs, and correspondence

This series documents investigations into sexual abuse allegations, per the Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA), including anonymous third-party reports and allegations made which the accused and/or accuser are no longer employed or housed by the DOC. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports, forms, and correspondence
This series documents inmate attendance at and the dates/times of institution programs. This series may include, is not limited to: summaries, rosters, and logs.
retention_statement: 4 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the property that inmates have in their possession, disposition of any unauthorized property, and any addition and/or removal of items. This series may include, but not limited to: forms and reports.

This series documents inmate requests for items, bed/cell changes, religious services/accommodations, and access to library resources. This series may include, but is not limited to: forms and correspondence.

This series documents the safety training and results of tests given to inmates prior to engaging in work or programs that include the use of chemicals, machinery, and injury-causing tools. This series may include, but is not limited to: forms and certifications.

This series documents all routine operations, management, monitoring of security protocols, including but not limited to: administrative visitors, duty assignments, call-in availability, hour watch and logging, equipment, keys, legal mail, tools, weapons. This series may include, but is not limited to: logs, schedules, inventories, reports, and rosters.
retention_statement: 4 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the segregation of inmates, including inmate lists, counts, dates in and out, meals, prescriptions administered, and cell maintenance. The series includes, but not limited to: logs, checklists, and reports.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the shakedowns of an individual(s) and/or unit(s) in which nothing was found that required the completion of an incident report. This series may include, but not limited to: reports and forms.
retention_statement: 1 Year after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents inmate participation in the Special Education (SPED) Program, including screenings, eligibility, Individualized Educational Plans (IEPs), previous education, and IQ and educational scores. This series may include, but is not limited to: forms, transcripts, and correspondence.

This series documents inmate educational program progress while housed within the DOC, including the dates enrolled, whether or not a GED was obtained, and what score was received on grade-level testing. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports.

This series documents disruptive incidents at Virginia Correctional Enterprises (VCE) involving inmates, personnel, volunteers, or visitors, including information about the incident, those involved, and the results of the investigation. This series may include, but is not limited to: correspondence, forms, reports.

series_title: Virginia Correctional Enterprises (VCE) Inmate Work Profile
series_description: This series documents an inmate's work at Virginia Enterprises (VCE), including pay rate, unofficial discipline, and any certifications the inmate received. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports, forms, and certificates.

This series documents orders submitted to Virginia Enterprises and material transactions. This series may but is not limited to: forms, receipts, inventories, purchase orders, warranty information, and correspondence.

This series documents the inmate visitation process, visitors, any restrictions placed on visitors, and requests and approvals for/denials of visits, but not visit recordings or daily logs. This series may include, but is not limited to: lists, forms, and correspondence.
retention_statement: 3 Years after superseded, obsolete, or rescinded
